_exec_summary.SummaryText:
It is the policy of Jasper Products to conduct its business in a socially responsible and ethical manner that protects safety, health and the environment. The goal is to be a leader within industry by emphasizing innovation and encouraging creative solutions, both of which will improve our competitive position. To that end the Company will:
1)-Integrate safety, fire, health, quality and environmental protection into every aspect of its business activities. 
Comply with all FDA, safety, fire, health and environmental laws or regulations without regard to the degree of enforcement. . 
2)-Encourage employees to initiate and maintain an open dialogue within the company and with the public or its agents regarding safety, fire, health and environmental matters. This includes recognizing and responding as appropriate to company and community concerns about such matters. 
3)-Follow relevant standards, good engineering practices, and principles of risk management to ensure Jasper Products safety, quality, fire, health and environmental protection activities are conducted responsibly. This specifically includes the design of new facilities or modifications to existing facilities. 
4)-Exhibit socially conscious leadership and demonstrate exemplary safety, quality, fire, health and environmental performance. 
5)-Conserve Company and natural resources by careful management of emissions and discharges and by eliminating unnecessary waste generation... 
6)-Conduct scientific hazard and risk assessments, as needed, to identify, characterize, and safely manage any present or future potential hazards of Company products and operations. 
7) Maintain a product stewardship program by taking the appropriate steps to understand the health effects of Jasper products and to inform employees, contractors, distributors, customers, and the public with regard to the proper handling, use, and disposal of these products. 
8)-Assess potential safety, fire, health and environmental liabilities prio

r to the sale, lease, transfer or purchase of real property.
9)-Ensure conformity with this policy by a comprehensive compliance program including audits.
Jasper Products was formed in 2000 by Ken and Dave Haubein to produce soy milk, rice milk and other nutritional drinks. The facility has gone under seven expansions in the past four years and now additionally processes flavored milks and meal replacement drinks. The main plant encompasses approximately 350,000 square feet and is positioned in a remote area of Southwest Missouri. Jasper Products does not store any regulated chemicals above the threshold limit with the exception of anhydrous ammonia. In an effort to mitigate any major release, JP installed two identical refrigeration systems and located them in opposite areas of the facility. Jasper Products is in full compliance with the OSHA PSM Standard and utilizes third parties for the PHA facilitation, compliance audits and training. JP has contracted with Garden City Community College to provide training to all employees responsible for ammonia handling. In addition all employees and contractors are trained in the JP Emergency Response Plan. A minimum of two emergency drills are performed each year. Jasper Products also maintains an excellent relationship with the local emergency response teams including the Joplin Fire Department, LEPC and a third party Hazardous Material Response Company. JP has a modern state of the art security and emergency response and ammonia detection system. Both fixed systems and portable ammonia detection equipment is made available to our trained responders.                                                                                                                                                                           In 2004 Jasper Products received the top honor from the International Dairy Foods Association as having the best overall safety performance for any Dairy processor in the United States. JP has also received se

veral awards from our Insurance carriers and their Loss Control team. JP employees achieved 1,000,000 hours without a lost time injury on March 19th 2004. No lost time injuries have occurred since September 2002. There have been zero releases of ammonia since 2000 and no additional recharges of the system have been necessary.
